maml:description.maml:para: Get error details.
Gets a list of image or video errors for the transformations requested in the last three days. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Specifies the maximum number of logs per day.
Limits search results to a specific image or video URL.
Size breakpoint, in pixels, configured in the policy. Use in conjunction with the URL, TransformationType, and PolicyID parameters.
Filters results to include transformations done in `REALTIME` or queued for `OFFLINE` processing. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `size` and `policyId` parameters.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Specifies the maximum number of logs per day.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Size breakpoint, in pixels, configured in the policy. Use in conjunction with the URL, TransformationType, and PolicyID parameters.
Filters results to include transformations done in `REALTIME` or queued for `OFFLINE` processing. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `size` and `policyId` parameters.
Limits search results to a specific image or video URL.
Get an image.
Gets a specific image by its ID. > Note: if your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts you need to specify the contract ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
The ID of the image. This ID usually represents the part of the URL after the scheme, host, and port.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Get a policy.
Gets all policies assigned to a specified policy set or returns a specific policy by its ID. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Unique identifier for a policy set.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get policy history.

Gets the policy history by its policy ID. The operation returns the full state of the policy at various points in time. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.

A unique identifier for the contract.

Get a policy set.
Gets all IVM policy sets or returns a specific policy set by its ID. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Create or modify a policy.

Creates a new IVM policy. Make sure to check whether a policy with the specified ID doesn't already exist by running the `Get-IVMPolicy` operation. Otherwise, the existing policy will be updated. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to provide the contract ID.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
A unique identifier for the contract.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Create a policy set.

Creates a new IVM policy set of either the `IMAGE` or `VIDEO` type in a specified geographic region. You can tab through the `-Region` and `-Type` options to see what values are acceptable. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to specify the contract ID.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
A unique identifier for the contract.
The default policy to deploy this policy set with. If unspecified the policy set will use the system default.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
A friendly name for the policy set.

The geographic region for which the media using this policy set is optimized. Altering the value on an existing policy set voids previously cached images and videos and require their transformation again. The supported geographic regions are `US`, `EMEA`, `ASIA`, `AUSTRALIA`, `JAPAN`, or `CHINA`. `EMEA` is Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
The type of media this policy set manages, either `IMAGE` or `VIDEO`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
A unique identifier for the contract.
The default policy to deploy this policy set with. If unspecified the policy set will use the system default.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
A friendly name for the policy set.

The geographic region for which the media using this policy set is optimized. Altering the value on an existing policy set voids previously cached images and videos and require their transformation again. The supported geographic regions are `US`, `EMEA`, `ASIA`, `AUSTRALIA`, `JAPAN`, or `CHINA`. `EMEA` is Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
The type of media this policy set manages, either `IMAGE` or `VIDEO`.

Unique identifier for a policy set.

Delete a policy set.
Deletes a policy set from a specified contract on both networks.

Roll back a policy.
Reverts the previous version of the policy and deploys it to the network. Use this operation to stop and reverse a policy rollout.
Unique identifier for a policy set.

Create or modify a policy.

Updates an existing IVM policy. Make sure to check whether the policy with the specified ID already exists by running the `Get-IVMPolicy` operation. If it doesn't, this function will create it. > Note: If your account has multiple IVM-enabled contracts, you need to provide the contract ID.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
A unique identifier for the contract.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
A unique identifier for the contract.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Network environment to execute the API request on.
Filters the policy to specify a single image or video policy. To get a policy's ID, run Get-IVMPolicy.. Use in conjunction with the `url`, `transformationType`, and `size` parameters.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Update a policy set.
Updates the `-Name` or `-Region` of an existing policy set on both networks.
Unique identifier for a policy set.
A friendly name for the policy set.

The geographic region for which the media using this policy set is optimized. Altering the value on an existing policy set voids previously cached images and videos and require their transformation again. The supported geographic regions are `US`, `EMEA`, `ASIA`, `AUSTRALIA`, `JAPAN`, or `CHINA`. `EMEA` is Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
A unique identifier for the contract.

The geographic region for which the media using this policy set is optimized. Altering the value on an existing policy set voids previously cached images and videos and require their transformation again. The supported geographic regions are `US`, `EMEA`, `ASIA`, `AUSTRALIA`, `JAPAN`, or `CHINA`. `EMEA` is Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
